entry.title: Lány Castle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lány Castle (pictured) is the summer residence of the president of the Czech Republic?

entry.title: a public TV station in California (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one of the founders of a public TV station in California gave 92 speeches in 90 days during a fundraising drive?

entry.title: Isabella Correa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Isabella Correa was one of the few Jewish women poets active in the Netherlands before the 19th century?

entry.title: Liber Gratissimus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in his Liber Gratissimus, Peter Damian argues that simony is a sin worse than adultery or murder?

entry.title: Michael Collins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Michael Collins has been called "one of the best clarinettists walking the planet" by The Times?

entry.title: Hyprov (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in Hyprov, off-Broadway audience members perform improv after undergoing stage hypnosis?

entry.title: Henriette Ith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Swiss-born peace activist Henriette Ith chose to marry an anarchist to regain Swiss citizenship?

entry.title: The Lit. Bar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Lit. Bar was funded to "Bring a Goddamn Bookstore to the Bronx"?
